intro: Tournefortia romeroi, commonly known as the Mexican sandcherry, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens, producing a showy display. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and arid regions.
